com.bfg.product
Class Order

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.bfg.product.Order
public class Order
extends java.lang.Object

Orders store purchases after they are confirmed, they record all the information about a purchase as it was at the time the purchase was made.

Copyright 2002, James M. Turner No warranty is made as to the fitness of this code for any particular purpose. It is included for demonstration purposes only.

Author:
James M. Turner

Constructor Detail

Order

public Order()

Order

public Order(Customer cust,
             Address ad,
             CreditCard cc,
             Cart cart)
Constructs an order object, taking it's data from a Customer, Address, CreditCard and Cart object handed in as arguments.
Parameters:
cust - The customer placing the order
ad - The shipping address for the order
cc - The credit card used to place the order
cart - The cart holding the items in the order
Method Detail

getItems

public java.util.Vector getItems()
Returns a vector containing the items as they were when the order was placed. In particular, any price changes to products will not be reflected in the copies in the order items.
Returns:
A vector containing CartItems

public void recordOrder()
                 throws java.lang.Exception
Records the order in the database, generating a new order number.

findOrder

public static Order findOrder(int orderNumber)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
Given an order number, loads that order from the database and returns it.
Parameters:
orderNumber - The order number to retrieve
Returns:
The order or null if not found.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - Thrown if there is an error loading the record from the database.
